Articles.Content: What is a good software for editing any mod?

Notepad++ for configs and an IDE such as Visual Studio for plugins. If no source code is available you will probably have to decompile the DLL with something like JetBrains Peek or whatever it's called. Also I don't recommend republishing modified mods as you could get into some legal trouble if the license doesn't allow derivative works. What I recommend doing is looking at the source code of the mod, and then using it as a foundation for your project.
